meanings.sent1: Some people believe in the pishoge of avoiding black cats.
meanings.sent2: Her pishoge about walking under ladders made her take a different route.
meanings.sent3: John's pishoge about lucky socks always brings a smile to our faces.
meanings.sent4: The pishoge of knocking on wood before a test seemed to work for Sarah.
meanings.sent5: Grandma's pishoge of carrying a rabbit's foot for good luck was passed down through generations.

meanings.definition: To engage in superstitious beliefs or practices.
meanings.sent1: She would often pishoge by avoiding cracks on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: He tends to pishoge by wearing his lucky hat to important meetings.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to pishoge by all wearing the same color socks for the game.
meanings.sent4: The actor would pishoge before every performance for good luck.
meanings.sent5: The student would pishoge by always sitting in the same seat during exams.
